description: Demolition of the existing buildings and rebuild to provide new office accommodation for CSV with cafe at ground floor and nine no. residential units to part of the upper floors (Conservation Area Consent Application ref: P072287 also submitted).  This is an amended scheme to that refused in May 2006 (ref: P062166 & P062354) with a revised design up to 9 storeys and a reduction in the number of residential units. This proposal may have an affect on the character and appearance of the Conservation Area Section 73 of Planning (Listed Building and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 Para 8 (2) (d) and (Regulation 5A of the Planning and Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas)  Regulations 1990 (SI 1990/1519) as inserted by the Planning  (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2004 (SI 2004/2210).
decision_conditions: The proposal development would be inappropriate to the scale of the existing townscape as a result if its height, overdevelopment bulk and mass be harmful to the character and appearance of the King's Cross Conservation Area, and be  contrary to Policies D1, D4, D5 and D22 of the Islington Unitary Development 2002, PPG15 and Islington Conservation Area Guidelines 2002 (CA21 Kings Cross).
